TopicTitle: Minor visual bug - J-90 Goliath engines glow from heat

Articles.Content:
Despite the thermal system not being active, the J-90 Golaith engines still glow like a very hot part, which I noticed on a night takeoff here.

I dislike the glowing of the engine's core to begin with, but here you can see that the entire outer cowling glows red hot as well.  This looks really out of place with the rest of the plane and none of the other jet engines do this that I have seen.  I take that back, seems both the other turbofans do it as well.   Frankly I don't even think it's a bug to be honest, but I really think the turbofans should not glow like this.

Edited March 2, 2023 by Razor235
